title: Ephraim Hardcastle for the Daily Mail
text: Chancellor Philip Hammond was informed two days before the general election that Mrs May’s then chief of staff, Nick Timothy (left), had decreed that he would be out on his ear on June 9. Hammond’s still in his job and a contender if there’s a No 10 vacancy. Out-of-a-job Timothy was reduced to writing a sorry-for-himself ‘diary’ in The Spectator last week. In preparation for the dressed-down state opening of Parliament tomorrow, Prince Philip – Colonel of the Grenadier Guards – ditched his uniform for Trooping the Colour. Unlike his son Prince Edward, who managed just 12 weeks with the Royal Marines. He was dressed-up like a Christmas tree in the gaudy outfit of a colonel of the London Regiment. He looked even odder sitting next to his brother, Falklands veteran Prince Andrew, who never wears uniform for the Trooping. ...read
